content: दानं [दा-ल्युट्] {@--1@} Giving, granting, teaching, &c. (in general). {@--2@} Delivering, handing over. {@--3@} A gift, donation, present; <ls>Ms. 2. 158</ls>; <ls>Bg. 17. 20</ls>; <ls>Y. 3. 274.</ls> {@--4@} Liberality, charity, giving away as charity, munificence; <ls>R. 1. 69</ls>; <ls>Bh. 2. 43.</ls> {@--5@} Ichor or the juice that exudes from the temples of an elephant in rut; सदानतोयेन विषाणि नागः <ls>Śi. 4. 63</ls>; <ls>Ki. 5. 9</ls>; <ls>V. 4. 25</ls>; <ls>Pt. 2. 70</ls> (where the word has sense 4 also); <ls>R. 2. 7</ls>, <ls n="R.">4. 45</ls>, <ls n="R.">5. 43.</ls> {@--6@} Bribery, as one of the four Upāyas or expedients of overcoming one's enemy; see उपाय. {@--7@} Cutting, dividing. {@--8@} Purification, cleaning. {@--9@} Protection. {@--10@} Pasture. {@--11@} Adding. --नः <ab>Ved.</ab> {@--1@} Distribution (of food), meal, especially a sacrificial meal. {@--2@} Part, possession, share. {@--3@} A distributor.
दाक, दाति, दातृ, दानं, दानु ,¦ &c. See under दा.
